channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2787] Just Do It (PIC)
[+2410] WTF? Red & Blue Don't Make Orange! (Pic)
item.description: Looks like someone has some explaining to do.

item.title: [+2401] The real reason for India's Population Growth (PIC)
item.description: it's not my opinion, it's what google algorithm says.

item.title: [+2010] Possibly The Greatest Single Picture Of All Time
item.description: We entered a period of extended mental paralysis after first seeing this picture. First, chocolate-covered bacon on a stick. Second, Monster truck smashing circle-track racer. Finally, American flag.

item.title: [+1940] Taiwanese man beats World of Warcraft
item.description: They said it couldn't be done. Well, to be fair, it can't -- however, if one were to track the completion of Blizzard's super successful World of Warcraft by the number of achievements a player had unlocked, then a Taiwanese player has effectively solved that game tape.

item.title: [+1913] How a Web Design Goes Straight to Hell (COMIC)
item.description: This is for all you web designers out there who have suffered as I have suffered.

item.title: [+1672] An Image of a True Coward (PIC)
item.description: This scum bag is a coward. I was in Washington DC and they were have another of the endless peace marches. I saw this pinhead out in the middle of the street wiping his feet on the US Flag. I went up and introduced myself, gave him my name, told him I was a Vet of the Navy, and a Defense Worker. I asked him to Identify himself. He would not.

item.title: [+1476] Senate GOP: How Dare Al Franken Make Us Vote Against Rape!
item.description: Senate Republicans are outraged at Sen. Al Franken (D-MN) due to their votes against an amendment he introduced, to crack down on the rape of employees of military contractors, now being used against them.

item.title: [+1052] Linux Could Even Look Like Windows If It Wanted To
item.description: A young Linux enthusiast that goes by the name PhrankDaChicken has created a script that will fully theme your Ubuntu desktop into an XP one.

item.title: [+1020] Google Launches Alternative DNS Resolver
item.description: Google has created a new DNS resolver system to speed up Web browsing.

item.title: [+935] WTF?! Feds Say You Have Pot Addiction
item.description: According to the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH), "Cannabis related disorders (CRDs), including cannabis abuse or dependence are a major public health issue." Why does the U.S. federal government keep pushing outdated lies about marijuana's health consequences and potential for addiction? Because it's a lucrative business.

item.title: [+841] Employee Manuals...Probably
item.description: Without naming any names, this is probably the training manual of a very popular coffee and donuts establishment.

item.title: [+782] Woman could get 3 years for taping 3 minutes of 'Twilight'
item.description: The 22-year-old Chicago woman faces up to three years in prison after being charged with a rarely invoked felony designed to prevent movie patrons from recording hot new movies and selling bootleg copies.

item.title: [+741] Google Phone Could Mean Free Mobile Phone Service
item.description: Images of the new Google phone surfaced this week after months of rumors. It appears the phone is manufactured under the Google brand, will use an even newer version of Android than that of the Droid−the only Android phone running 2.0, and most important, may use VoiP service.

item.title: [+674] Police Brutality in America by State (INFOGRAPHIC)
item.description: Policemen have a bad reputation in many places, and for many reasons. But is it justified? Well according to a recent study published by injusticeeverywhere.com, it may be. The following, is a look at the various police brutality rates across America. Of course, this begs the questions, are they really there to "protect and serve"?

item.title: [+653] Catholics Slam PETA Nude adopt-a-mutt poster
item.description: The Catholic League has fired a broadside against animal rights outfit PETA after the campaigning organization decided to ask Playboy model and Dancing With The Stars contestant Joanna Krupa to whip off her kit in defense of homeless mutts. The naked angelic model's 'carefully-placed crucifix' is causing a stir.

item.title: [+649] Willow Says No Way To Buffy The Vampire Slayer Remake
item.description: Alyson Hannigan says there's no way they'll get her involved in it. Not even for a cameo. She says, "Not without Joss. Joss is the only reason that we would go back. I mean, it's just ridiculous to think of that TV show without Joss. That's just silly to me… And all the fans know that, too, so I don't know what they're thinking."

item.title: [+593] How to Increase Your Chances of Getting Laid By 100% (graph)
[+577] "My Life is Twilight" - it's like FML, But Sadder
item.description: Some idiot started a site called “My Life is Twilight“, where obsessed “Twihards” can anonymously post their sad musings, similar to F my life. Here are the 10 saddest entries posted thusfar.

item.title: [+532] Court Refuses To Order Shutdown of OpenBitTorrent
item.description: Last month, the Swedish ISP Portlane was sued by several Hollywood movie studios for hosting OpenBitTorrent, claiming that the tracker is a re-branded copy of one previously operated by The Pirate Bay. Now the Stockholm District Court has rejected calls to order the shutdown of the tracker.
